pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:0.5.eng: The training rule on borrowed robes

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī piṇḍāya caritvā allacīvaraṃ pattharitvā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.2.eng: there was a nun who, after walking for almsfood, spread out her damp robe and entered her dwelling.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.3.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī taṃ cīvaraṃ pārupitvā gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.3.eng: A second nun put on that robe and went to the village for alms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.4.eng: Soon afterwards the first nun came out and asked the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.6.eng: The nuns told her what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.7.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.7.eng: She then complained and criticized the second nun,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhunī mayhaṃ cīvaraṃ anāpucchā pārupissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.8.eng: “How could a nun put on my robe without asking permission?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.9.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.9.eng: She told the nuns what had happened,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.10.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.10.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ anāpucchā pārupissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.11.eng: “How could a nun put on another nun’s robe without asking permission?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ anāpucchā pārupatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.12.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ anāpucchā pārupissati.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.17.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.17.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.18.1.eng: ‘If a nun wears a robe taken on loan, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:1.18.1.comm: “A robe taken on loan” renders cīvarasaṅkamanīya. Sp 1.16: Cīvarasaṅkamanīyanti saṅkametabbaṁ cīvaraṁ; aññissā santakaṁ anāpucchā gahitaṁ puna paṭidātabbacīvaranti attho, “Cīvarasaṅkamanīya means a robe to be returned; a robe belonging to another, taken without permission, and to be given back.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.1.6.pli: upasampannāya pañcannaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ tassā vā adinnaṃ taṃ vā anāpucchā nivāseti vā pārupati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.1.6.eng: if she wears any of the five robes belonging to a fully ordained nun, and it has not been given to her, nor has she asked permission to use it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.1.pli: Upasampannāya upasampannasaññā cīvarasaṅkamanīyaṃ dhāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.2.pli: Upasampannāya vematikā cīvarasaṅkamanīyaṃ dhāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.3.pli: Upasampannāya anupasampannasaññā cīvarasaṅkamanīyaṃ dhāreti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.4.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she takes on loan a robe belonging to her and then wears it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.5.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.6.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.2.7.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.2.eng: if the robe has been given to her;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.2.comm: The commentaries are silent, but sā presumably refers to the owner of the robe.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.3.pli: taṃ vā āpucchā nivāseti vā pārupati vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.3.eng: if she wears it after asking permission;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.4.eng: if her own robe has been stolen;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.5.eng: if her own robe has been lost;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.8.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.3.9.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:0.5.eng: The training rule on robe-cloth for the community

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā upaṭṭhākakulaṃ thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.2.eng: a family that was supporting the nun Thullanandā said to her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.3.eng: “Venerable, we’re going to give robe-cloth to the Sangha of nuns.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.5.eng: “You’re very busy,” and she created an obstacle for them.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tassa kulassa gharaṃ ḍayhati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.6.eng: Soon afterwards the house of that family burned down.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.7.eng: They then complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā amhākaṃ deyyadhammaṃ antarāyaṃ karissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.8.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā create an obstacle for our gift?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.9.pli: Ubhayenāmha paribāhirā bhogehi ca puññena cā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.9.eng: Now we have neither possessions nor merit.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.10.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.10.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.11.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.11.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.12.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā gaṇassa cīvaralābhaṃ antarāyaṃ karissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.12.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā create an obstacle for the community to get robe-cloth?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī gaṇassa cīvaralābhaṃ antarāyaṃ akāsī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.13.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī gaṇassa cīvaralābhaṃ antarāyaṃ karissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.16.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.18.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.19.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī gaṇassa cīvaralābhaṃ antarāyaṃ kareyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.19.1.eng: ‘If a nun creates an obstacle for the community to get robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.6.eng: the Sangha of nuns is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.8.pli: channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ vikappanupagaṃ pacchimaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.8.eng: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be assigned to another.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.8.comm: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp, see Kd 8:3.1.6. According to Kd 8:21.1.4 the size referred to here is no smaller than 8 by 4 sugataṅgula, “standard fingerbreadths”. For an explanation of sugata as “standard” and the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.10.pli: “kathaṃ ime cīvaraṃ na dadeyyun”ti antarāyaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.10.eng: if she creates an obstacle with the thought, “What can be done so that these people don’t give robe-cloth?”, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.11.pli: Aññaṃ parikkhāraṃ antarāyaṃ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.11.eng: If she creates an obstacle for another requisite, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.12.pli: Sambahulānaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā anupasampannāya vā cīvaraṃ vā aññaṃ vā parikkhāraṃ antarāyaṃ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.12.eng: If she creates an obstacle for a number of nuns or for a single nun or for someone who is not fully ordained to get robe-cloth or another requisite, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.2.eng: if she can show a benefit in obstructing them;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.5.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhunisaṅghassa akālacīvaraṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.2.eng: At that time out-of-season robe-cloth had been given to the Sangha of nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.3.pli: Atha kho bhikkhunisaṅgho taṃ cīvaraṃ bhājetukāmo sannipati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.3.eng: and the Sangha gathered to share it out.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā antevāsiniyo bhikkhuniyo pakkantā honti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.4.eng: Just then the nuns who were pupils of the nun Thullanandā were away.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.6.pli: “ayye, bhikkhuniyo pakkantā, na tāva cīvaraṃ bhājīyissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.6.eng: “Venerables, there are nuns who are away. We cannot distribute the robe-cloth until they get back.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.7.eng: And she blocked the distribution of robe-cloth.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.8.pli: Bhikkhuniyo na tāva cīvaraṃ bhājīyissatīti pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.8.eng: Since the robe-cloth could not be distributed until those nuns returned, other nuns left.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.9.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī antevāsinīsu bhikkhunīsu āgatāsu taṃ cīvaraṃ bhājāpesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.9.eng: Then, when her pupils returned, Thullanandā had that robe-cloth distributed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.10.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.10.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā dhammikaṃ cīvaravibhaṅgaṃ paṭibāhissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.11.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā block a legitimate distribution of robe-cloth?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī dhammikaṃ cīvaravibhaṅgaṃ paṭibāhatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.12.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī dhammikaṃ cīvaravibhaṅgaṃ paṭibāhissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.15.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.17.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.17.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.18.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī dhammikaṃ cīvaravibhaṅgaṃ paṭibāheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:1.18.1.eng: ‘If a nun blocks a legitimate distribution of robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.1.6.eng: it is distributed by a unanimous Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.1.8.pli: kathaṃ imaṃ cīvaraṃ na bhājeyyāti paṭibāhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.1.8.eng: if she blocks it with the thought, “What can be done so that this robe-cloth isn’t distributed?”, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she blocks it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she blocks it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she blocks it, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.3.2.eng: if she blocks it after demonstrating a benefit;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.3.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc27:2.3.5.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:0.5.eng: The training rule on giving robes

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī naṭānampi naṭakānampi laṅghakānampi sokajjhāyikānampi kumbhathūṇikānampi samaṇacīvaraṃ deti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā was giving monastic robes to actors, dancers, acrobats, magicians, and musicians, saying,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.4.pli: Naṭāpi naṭakāpi laṅghakāpi sokajjhāyikāpi kumbhathūṇikāpi thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā parisati vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti—

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.5.pli: “ayyā thullanandā bahussutā bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.5.eng: “Venerable Thullanandā is a learned reciter; she’s confident and skilled at giving teachings.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.6.eng: Give to her; work for her!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā … tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.7.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā agārikassa samaṇacīvaraṃ dassatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.8.eng: “How can Venerable Thullanandā give monastic robes to householders?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī agārikassa samaṇacīvaraṃ detī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī agārikassa samaṇacīvaraṃ dassati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.12.eng: “How can the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.14.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.15.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī agārikassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā samaṇacīvaraṃ dadeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives a monastic robe to a householder or a male wanderer or a female wanderer, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.8.pli: bhikkhuñca sāmaṇerañca ṭhapetvā yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.8.eng: any male wanderer apart from Buddhist monks and novice monks.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.10.pli: bhikkhuniñca sikkhamānañca sāmaṇeriñca ṭhapetvā yā kāci paribbājikasamāpannā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.10.eng: any female wanderer apart from Buddhist nuns, trainee nuns, and novice nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.12.eng: a mark has been made is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.13.eng: If she gives it away, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.2.2.eng: if she gives one to her mother or father;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.2.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.2.6.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:0.5.eng: The training rule on letting the time expire

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā upaṭṭhākakulaṃ thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.2.eng: a family that was supporting the nun Thullanandā said to her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.3.pli: “sace mayaṃ, ayye, sakkoma, bhikkhunisaṅghassa cīvaraṃ dassāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.3.eng: “If we’re able, Venerable, we’ll give robe-cloth to the Sangha of nuns.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vassaṃvuṭṭhā bhikkhuniyo cīvaraṃ bhājetukāmā sannipatiṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.4.eng: Just then the nuns who had completed the rainy-season residence had gathered to distribute robe-cloth.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.6.eng: “Please wait, Venerables. The Sangha is expecting more cloth.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.9.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī yena taṃ kulaṃ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te manusse etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.9.eng: She then went to that family and said to them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.10.eng: “Please give the robe-cloth to the Sangha of nuns.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.11.pli: “Na mayaṃ, ayye, sakkoma bhikkhunisaṅghassa cīvaraṃ dātun”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.11.eng: “We’re sorry, but we’re not able to give robe-cloth to the Sangha.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.12.eng: Thullanandā told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.13.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.13.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.14.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā dubbalacīvarapaccāsāya cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.14.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā allow the robe season to expire because of an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.15.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī dubbalacīvarapaccāsāya cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.15.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.18.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī dubbalacīvarapaccāsāya cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.18.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.20.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.20.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.21.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī dubbalacīvarapaccāsāya cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:1.21.1.eng: ‘If a nun lets the robe season expire because of an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.6.pli: “sace mayaṃ sakkoma, dassāma karissāmā”ti vācā bhinnā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.6.eng: they have said, “If we’re able, then we’ll give, then we’ll act.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.8.pli: anatthate kathine vassānassa pacchimo māso, atthate kathine pañca māsā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.8.eng: for one who has not participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is the last month of the rainy season; for one who has participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is the five month period.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.8.comm: “Robe-making ceremony” refers to the kathina saṅghakamma, the making of the kathina robe, and the rejoicing in the process, all three together represented by the words (an)atthate kathine . “The five month period” is the last month of the rainy season plus the four months of the cold season. See also kathina in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.10.pli: anatthate kathine vassānassa pacchimaṃ divasaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.10.eng: for one who has not participated in the robe-making ceremony, if she goes beyond the last day of the rainy season, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.11.pli: Atthate kathine kathinuddhāradivasaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.11.eng: For one who has participated in the robe-making ceremony, if she goes beyond the day on which the robe season ends, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.1.11.comm: The robe season ends if the Sangha decides to forgo the robe-season privileges, or if the nun leaves the monastery where she spent the rains residence and gives up any intention of making a robe before the end of the cold season, see Bi Pc 30:1.1.8, Bu NP 1:3.1.4 and Kd 7:13.2.1.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.2.1.pli: Dubbalacīvare dubbalacīvarasaññā cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.2.1.eng: If it is an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth, and she perceives it as such, and she lets the robe season expire, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.2.1.comm: I take dubbalacīvara as shorthand for dubbalacīvarapaccāsā, and I translate accordingly.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.2.2.pli: Dubbalacīvare vematikā cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.2.2.eng: If it is an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth, but she is unsure of it, and she lets the robe season expire, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.2.3.eng: If it is an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth, but she does not perceive it as such, and she lets the robe season expire, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.2.4.eng: If it is not an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth, but she perceives it as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.2.5.eng: If it is not an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.2.6.eng: If it is not an uncertain expectation of robe-cloth, and she does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.3.2.eng: if she can show a benefit in hindering it;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.3.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc29:2.3.5.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.
